website_summaries.verdict: A popular brand in remote starters that's also a budget-friendly, good choice for consumers who prefer streamlined remotes.
pros: Features one-button remotes that are easy to use
cons: Challenging to install, and the included instructions lack detail
Range is isn't as long as some competing models

customer_reviews.title: Replace the batteries with high quality lithium to increase longevity of remote range
customer_reviews.text: Works great after over a year in every way but one...the original batteries that the remotes came with lost a significant amount of capability in the first month, turning that incredible range into as little as 5 feet in some cases...after 6 months, at best, the remotes would only work up to about 40 feet away...the instructions were good but I wouldn't encourage anyone to install an alarm unless they have some experience with car electrical systems...the alarm hooks into many different circuits to achieve all of its functionality...
customer_reviews.author: Jaye

customer_reviews.title: Good value, straightforward design.
customer_reviews.text: Good value in a simple 1-way vehicle security system. I am using it in an equipment trailer. Nice to have a remote to arm/disarm from a distance and to let would-be thieves that the trailer has an alarm. Instructions are straightforward and installs like many of the older Directed Electronics products (DIY install). Getting the shock sensor adjusted and working correctly for each application is always iffy. Directed Electronics tech support would prefer you take their products to an "authorized installer".
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Best item ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome item it comes a long way cold days in hot days I would buy this and give it forward as a gift two others and recommended highly is super awesome as I live in the state of Utah it's super cold here just one click out my window my car starts nice and warm within 10 minutes hot inside not freezing cold thank you for this awesomeness😍😌😀😁😜
customer_reviews.author: Regina L. Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Great for a basic remote start system
customer_reviews.text: I have installed around four of these systems. The pinout and wiring diagram is super simple to follow and you can end up keeping the factory lock/unlock and alarm system with the separate fob. Doing so narrows down the amount of wires you need to very few. The only difficulty is coming across vehicles with immobilizer systems to work around and allow the vehicle to start.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sucks to hook up
customer_reviews.text: Will work for any vehicle. Be nice if it came with the instructions of what wire, color code and location of such wire on the vehicle that is says it connects to, they only give what the wires are on the supplied box and it's vage as well lots of utube searching and internet searching this unit sucks trying to hook up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am an ex car audio installer. It is the typical DEI alarm. This one has teh shock sensor built in so the brain needs to be mounted well. For a cheap alarm it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: Great lost cost option alarm
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Avital alarms. This one is a great, low price option with tons of features. Lets get this out of the way now, I did not receive the keypads shown in the photos, it came with the updated newer style keypads. This was a huge plus. There are about 200 wires to hook up with this, so if your good with auto wiring, this should not be a problem. Has very detailed instructions. I can start my car from almost 3/4 of a mile away with this. That is very helpful for times your parked at a mall of office building, and you want your car to be the perfect temp waiting for you.
customer_reviews.author: ACUSERCOR

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it for price.
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I needed. Remotes are decent quality. Straight forward install. I like the quieter chirp for arm/disarm. The little siren hides nice and is loud enough. I bought it for mainly remote door locks. The alarm/ignition cut out are a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzled Gringo

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: Went with these rather than trying to go to the dealer and have remotes programmed. Cheaper and gave me a trunk remote my car's original remotes would give me.
customer_reviews.author: David Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Great to use but not to install.
customer_reviews.text: After installing one in my personal vehicle(avital 4103),I ordered this model and installed in my company van. No more having to go outside in the mornings to preheat my van.Installing is not for the faint of heart.I work with electrical control circuits everyday and installing these was fairly difficult. There is info to be found on the internet,but I did find some to be wrong and could have caused problems if I didn't realize the errors. These are pretty much made to be installed by a professional/dealer,so don't expect any support from the maker. Buyer beware, this can be a complex install depending on your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a 1999 ford f150 so I really didn't need an autostart with all the fancy features. The setup was fairly easy for an older model. I didn't like how the key fob button choices are. You can set it for a 1-click, 2-click, or 3-click start but i'd rather have one thats a press and hold. I sometimes start it just in my pocket, however, the fob is really small and simple. Range is so-so but what do you expect for something this cheap. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: jpoppinmoneyunit

customer_reviews.title: Would be a bonus if they put the programming light on the antenna like Audiovox does with theirs
customer_reviews.text: Very Simple install. Have installed the Prestige & Valiant lines for years. What you're getting here is a basic 1 button Remote Start. No extra frills. Would be a bonus if they put the programming light on the antenna like Audiovox does with theirs. The range is better than most in this price range. Just make sure you ground the neutral safety switch wire. Yes, their instructions could be way better. DEI is for professionals.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent range!
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great. Installation was easy. This was my second DEI remote start install so have become more familiar with the system. Make sure you do your homework if attempting a DIY project, it may seem a bit overwhelming to begin with. If your not comfortable cutting and splicing the wiring in your car I wouldn't recommend doing it yourself. If that doesn't bother you and you have a basic knowledge of electronics and how to test circuits etc than you can save a lot of money doing it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Miller-lds

customer_reviews.title: No one would install
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't find any mechanic to install this. Totally wasted money. Took to long to find out, so we're stuck with it. Wish we'd known that before.
customer_reviews.author: Sprite

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Installed on 2005 Toyota Corolla.
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this unit on my 2005 Toyota Corolla. It works beautifully. I did have to get a bypass module, which was pretty easy to install. I have never installed a remote starter before but it's pretty straight forward once you have the writing diagram for your car. There are a lot of wires, but don't be intimidated. Just take your time and verify circuits with a multimeter. It took me about 4 hours to do the install but we'll worth it. It was minus 10 degrees in NY this morning!
customer_reviews.author: Rob D.

customer_reviews.title: excellent alarm
customer_reviews.text: would be a 5 star rating if it had a silent alarm, in a condo where if you left early in the morning it made too loud of a beep and wake up the neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: 2015 mitsubishi mirage install
customer_reviews.text: First off I'm no professional installer but I have a ton of know how!!!. If your vehicle requires a bypass unit(modern veichles with key FOB)It will save you time. You will need the XKloader2 to update the firmware <<(dedicated to your vehicle).
customer_reviews.author: Amos & Netta

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive which I like..
customer_reviews.text: The range isnt as advertised... Very sensitive which I like... But thay range that range sucks...
customer_reviews.author: sokchanthy

customer_reviews.title: Good system
customer_reviews.text: Brought this to install in a Honda Accord. This is a very good system gave it a four star because the sensitivity censor could be a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Avital 3300
customer_reviews.text: Ok if your just looking for a cheap basic alarm that has a nice 2way fob this is a can't miss range seems to be decent I would recommend adding a motion sensor to the alarm....But it's a good basic for a cheap price
customer_reviews.author: MARKUS Walker

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it stopped working properly after a few months of use
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Works now but really terrible experience to get there!
customer_reviews.text: After three trips and hours waiting (6 hours for the install and 3 hours of us waiting around in the store while they troubleshoot) between two install locations 20 miles apart, it turns out that the "brain" of this product didn't work. Works well now after they finally figured it out and I paid the extra charge to replace that piece. If I wasn't already invested in the install time and cost, I would have sent the thing back. Not nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Great product I would definitely recommend it to anyone. 1 year since my purchased and still working great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would like to see more responsive lock and unlock buttons on ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the avital 3300L . I received a 3300. I would like to see more responsive lock and unlock buttons on remotes. Sometimes you have to press them hard in order to work . other than that its a decent alarm. Next time I'll spend a few more dollars and get a viper or Clifford.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same brand as Viper excellent alarm!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alarm. Very fair price. Same company as Viper. Great deal! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Toney

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: i have installed, i think i need to program correctly but works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Niola Valarezo

customer_reviews.title: Installed in about one hour and works great. I'm ready for some cold weather so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed in about one hour and works great. I'm ready for some cold weather so I can start from inside and go out to a warm car
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Range Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit with a pair of 524N actuators, works great, easy installation and good range. Would recommend if you are looking for a affordable option.
customer_reviews.author: US Veteran 33W

customer_reviews.title: NICE ITEM, NICE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: NOT TOO HARD TO INSTALL, NICE UNIT. BEST PRICE ON INTERNET. Works perfect. Already has caught me a potential thief!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: 3100 >3100LX. This (3100) comes with a 514ln soft chirp siren. The (3100lx)comes without a siren. Thats really the only diffrence, i think. I have installed 4 of these bad puppys so far and they all work up to par.
customer_reviews.author: CRUZ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! I have it on my 2010 Toyota Highlander and my wife's Honda CRV.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, Cheap Price, Straight Forward Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Avital 4113LX to replace an Avital 4111 I bought at best buy. My only regret is not having gone to amazon to buy the 4113LX previously (as it cost me a quarter of the amount I paid for the 4111). Easy install, plugs right into the Xpress Kit Immobilizer Bypass (PKALL)via the D2D port. Easy to understand diagnostics too (should anything impede the starters ability to do its job). Bottom line, its worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos.D

customer_reviews.title: Everything feels solid and the wires have nice insulation.
customer_reviews.text: Solid basic alarm system. This is basically an re-branded entry level viper alarm. Everything feels solid and the wires have nice insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: worst alarm ever
customer_reviews.text: came with one control not working and the shock sensor is also not working this alarm is just a waste of money worst one i ever installed
customer_reviews.author: Julio Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Great buy for just wanting to have a simple alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: avital remote start 4113lx
customer_reviews.text: This remote start is great. I installed myself and it took just over 2 hours. Just make sure you have a test light to check for the always hot wires and which are accessory with the ignition on. And I found a site that tells which wires and where they are for installation. You can search your year vehicle and model followed by remote start wiring diagram and it should come up. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product for open vehicles or motorcycles along with ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on my Slingshot, and sends me notice almost to the distance advertized while inside a store. Highly recommend this product for open vehicles or motorcycles along with the dual motion sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good alarm for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had it installed professionally in 30 minutes and it works. For a simple alarm with a starter kill it does its job. Anything can be stolen today and it's a good enough deterrent for what I have it in.
customer_reviews.author: G. C. Sevilla

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend DIY installation unless you have previous experience with auto ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed without any issues on an Oldsmobile Intrigue. I wouldn't recommend DIY installation unless you have previous experience with auto electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Burm

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product was professionally installed and they weren't able to get this unit to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Braden

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, But expect to pay for extra harnesses and cables to work on vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: Everything was there that I needed to wire and configure my car starter. No issues with everything so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: I have installed too manyof these to count! I love the simplicity and easy of use for my customers. DEI is an awesome company and these kits are compatible with almost all aftermarket bypasses and interfaces... especially DEI products!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Johnson

customer_reviews.title: works great! Has programming for a 5 minute turbo cool ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a 05 Duramax, works great! Has programming for a 5 minute turbo cool down cycle, money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Shann

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This device was purchased for my 2008 Toyota Corolla. It took about 1.5 hours to install (about a month ago), and it is still working without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Bought it from Amazon. Got it installed outside. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it from Amazon. Got it installed outside. Saves money that way. Decent range.
customer_reviews.author: Devesh Kheterpal

customer_reviews.title: be carefull before buyint
customer_reviews.text: ok so the picture it shows a lock and unlock button on the key fob. When I got the item it only had one button for both lock and unlock. And you may think so what its not a big deal however, it becomes an issue when you don't know if your car is locked or unlocked. plus I hate buying things that show a picture of one thing and you get something else. I will say amazon and the seller were great about it. I told them of the issue and got my return shipping paid for and was refunded for the shipping I paid. so buy with confidence
customer_reviews.author: lawrence l.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Wife Warm Car
customer_reviews.text: We had to add an interface module to make it all work but all in all we are happy with this device
customer_reviews.author: Milton B.

customer_reviews.title: Avital 4113 remote start
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and simple remote start system. Installation requires a lot planning and patience but saves a lot of money. It works perfect. This is my second Avital system.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Can remote start be added or no and my siren was not on box?
customer_reviews.author: Matt Vieira

customer_reviews.title: Never put it in..
customer_reviews.text: Force you to get it installed..company won't give out wire diagram unless your a shop owner
customer_reviews.author: monica jones

customer_reviews.title: Rmote Starter
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift to my brother from my sister-in-law. She asked I order it for her. My brother loves it since he lives in New Hampshire and can start his truck (leaves for work around 6:30AM) from inside his house.
customer_reviews.author: pets

customer_reviews.title: Good fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: worked as designed, im a fan of D.E.I. products.Good fast shipping also
customer_reviews.author: Cali Dezert

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have installed one of these on my own vehicle. It's a great device, as long as you know how to install it. The items arrived as described. It would be nice if the installation instructions where easier to find, I had to a small amount of digging on google for the pdf.
customer_reviews.author: The Carlson's

customer_reviews.title: love it but its not in yet!!!!
customer_reviews.text: just saving up thr money to have it done right found a place now need a few more bucks know how that goes but my mom and sister have the same one*****
customer_reviews.author: DONNA CUDO

customer_reviews.title: Best alarm you can buy, in its price range
customer_reviews.text: Does what is supposed to do, with very few false triggers from the shock sensor. I like it a whole bunch
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I need in northeast ohio. It was a little more difficult to install than anticipated. But I love it now that it's snowing and cold
customer_reviews.author: Ford power

customer_reviews.title: Not a Consumer Friendly Company
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturer offers no customer support for end users. Consumers are on your own. Many cars with alarms require an alarm bypass module. Mine was $35. I returned this item. I see more potential headaches than savings. I have installed a similar unit on another car. It is not a fun job but not overly complicated. But why deal with a company that won't support you? Below from their website; Directed's Award Winning Technical Support Avital systems are intended for professional installation, but the award-winning Directed Electronics technical support department will be happy to assist with general, non-installation-related, questions about your Avital system. Please call (800) 876-0800. Press 2, then 1. Contact Us Dealer Locator
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kelly

customer_reviews.title: peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: very easy to install did the job thanks i would buy this product again many times over.what are you waiting for?,your car to be gone.
customer_reviews.author: randall

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the Picture.
customer_reviews.text: What the picture shows is not what your going to get. As I was getting ready to put this on a Dodge Dakota, I was look for a remote that had a LOCK and UNLOCK button ...but the remote I was given only had UNLOCK/LOCK button together and a trunk button. (what to me is useless).. this is the second time I installed Avital 3l100L ... It a little bit of a weak unit (needing relays for every thing that you hook up... not built into the unit itself ) I would say that Valet 710 is twice the unit this one is, (Valet 710 is out of production =( )
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Avital Alarm
customer_reviews.text: Hi there I just have to say that this item is a very effective item and ill buy it again any time I need a alarm anyway that's all for now I hope the info was helpful as it was short and straight to the point
customer_reviews.author: gerard cox

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS GREAT FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: All I can say it is a great deal for the price. I wrote a negative review about this before, but it was a problem with car information and not the remote start. It works great and it is easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: DEER

customer_reviews.title: alarm
customer_reviews.text: For the product the customer sevice is terrible would not help you if you were not a dealer to install alarmars.As far as the seller or Amazon there were great.
customer_reviews.author: springeye

customer_reviews.title: Worked as promised
customer_reviews.text: Being a service proffessional for over thirty years I feel I can offer a review here. I have installed hundreds of these products over the years and this one was all it should be. Instructions well written, quality is good. The range was actually a little better than they had said. This is my favorite for a simple remote start. But do your homework and get what you really need, but if you find you want this, I have always enjoyed installing this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product but if you run into problems installing it you're on your own. I contact Directed (the manufacturer of the Avital 3300L) and after 15 mins on hold they asked if I was a dealer. When I said no they said I couldn't get support and that was the end of that. Installation intrustions are pretty good though but obviously it's going to get tricky when it comes to wiring into your lock/unlock system since there are many different methods car makers can choice to do this and this system tries to work with all of them. Oh and I have a PhD in physics and still couldn't get it to open my doors remotely.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: buy local
customer_reviews.text: Called 2 different installers locally who said they could and would install the item but discouraged me. Both told me that even if you dont have me do the work, buy local and get audiovox. I was going to have to buy an additional part to make this particular model function in my car. In addition,if the product should fail in the future I'd not get any support from this brand. So I returned it.!
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: After buying this item I had a professional set it up and he found out they sent me a fried box. When I called to get a new one they said I was out of luck! This product is garbage and the company will not fix there mistakes worst product I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.author: Joey gillen

customer_reviews.title: Shipped completely wrong item?!
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrong item. Instead of receiving car alarm system, I received a couple of magnetic alarm contacts.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product on Dec. 13 and it said it would be here before Christmas as it was a gift for my husband. Here it is the 27th and it's still not here. Not very happy so I couldn't rate the product on performance.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas dvoracek

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I tried to install it myself and couldn't figure it out so I tried contacting multiple places to see if they would do it but no one will install it because I don't by it through them. I tried to send it back but the seller is refusing the return. So now I have to either sell it or find someone to install it... which.... hasn't been very successful. Not thrilled with this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great name-brand alarms!
customer_reviews.text: Top brand alarm, and very easy to install. I've installed many different variations and models of Avital remote starts, keyless entries and alarms. Always have trouble-free installation with Directed brands and add-ons are easy to interface. I've also used these for garage alarms powered by 12v UPS and 12v switches on windows and doors. Put the siren outside under an eave or awning. You will need some extra wiring depending on distance of switches, etc from main unit. Works like a charm in any application. Will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: but works perfect to start the older work truck from inside the ...
customer_reviews.text: Almost a half a year later and working with no issues. Range is about 300' max, but works perfect to start the older work truck from inside the house in the cold frosty mornings. Take your time and if you have a decent automotive electrical knowledge shouldn't be an issue installing. I soldered all my connections as I didn't want issues with crimp splices down the road. Wrap them with electrical tape and scotch coat (liquid electrical tape) and good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Meeeee

customer_reviews.title: Basic alarm
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special about this. It works as advertised. Directed products are solid as always
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: First let me tell you that this thing drove me up the wall from friday night till sunday morning. It comes with very very little instruction on what to look for and where to place wires for the D.I.Yer. I am very hands on and mechanically inclined, I had to download extra instructions for my Mazda to learn my wiring diagram and colors. But with all that work I put in I am completely satisfied with my purchase and it performs like i thought it should. Great buy if you DIY or if you take it to a professional.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. ILL ATL

customer_reviews.title: There were absolutely no instructions with this, and a ...
customer_reviews.text: There were absolutely no instructions with this, and a BUNCH of wires! My husband can usually install anything on a car, but he was at a complete loss with this. I had to return it
customer_reviews.author: Loving Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this for me for Christmas. I called my local installer of such thingamajigs and he said this is the same brand he sells/installs, and highly recommended it. --- I've had it for about two weeks now and I LOVE it! Starts every time and has a very good range! I can start from inside the house, without even pointing the remote at the car!!!
customer_reviews.author: T Wales

customer_reviews.title: Best value I found for Remote Start without the need for keyless entry
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value for a remote start. I installed this along with the Xpress PKALL in my Dad's 2006 Lexus ES330 for less than $80. I had to download the install guide from Directed's website and search for the vehicles wiring chart online. I have some experience installing car audio & security. The built in relays made for a neat install compared to the old modules with seperate relay banks.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Critic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy for DIY
customer_reviews.text: The 3100L arrived on time and brand new. Very happy purchase. Found and followed instructions on web for a DIY install in 2001 Civic. Took a few hours to install but everything worked out great. Already programmed and ready to use. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: sym

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this unit if you're looking for top notch quality
customer_reviews.text: Distance isn't very far and the remote seems to beep every now and again when nothing is happening to my car. Not sure why it does that, except maybe to alert me the time is slowing on its clock? I wouldn't recommend this unit if you're looking for top notch quality.
customer_reviews.author: John N

customer_reviews.title: Best price, great product
customer_reviews.text: Best price, great product, easy to use, includes 2 remotes, works excellent on my 2011 Acura MDX, I did not attempt to install myself instead I paid a professional installer and had coffee so it was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: ESPEC

customer_reviews.title: good for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Good remote start with decent features for the price point, But service and tech help is non existant at the manufacturer. I would like to see more custom centric service from the manufacturer. Look to the excalibur and Compustar stuff instead.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Balls

customer_reviews.title: Great remote starter
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The instructions that come in the box are garbage but you can go to their website and get great instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!!
customer_reviews.text: I got it for a Christmas present..He loved it and is going to get some help installing it, There are alot of wires and parts ..but anyone that messes with wiring and is savy , per other reviews it sounds like it is going to be great. That is what won me over , was the great reviews. Thanks !!
customer_reviews.author: VictoriaT

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's fine, but it's super expensive to put in an ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's fine, but it's super expensive to put in an '05 Jetta. Like $450 plus using a spare key. So i didn't. Should have checked it out first before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Have bought two of these for a couple vehicles and I really like them. The first one was a challenge to install with no prior experience but the second was a breeze. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: T R A V I S

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a basic alarm system to install in my 2003 Honda Pilot and chose this one because of the price and features. I had it installed and it works great. Exactly what I needed without all the extra bells and whistles.

customer_reviews.author: Landon Spain

customer_reviews.title: Good quality 2-way pager alarm kit Same as viper/clifford, et al (same company)
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, instructions geared toward installers (so you need to know what wires to connect to in your car) The manual provides a little guidance, came with siren, LCD remote, control unit, wiring pigtails, and remote antenna. Installation (one you identify the various connections in your car) not too bad, recommend professional installation unless you really have time and patience available to you. Note Directed electronics makes virtually all of the car alarms (Clifford, Viper, Avital, etc) so its the same unit. This version includes internal relays for the parking lights and door lock/unlock and start disable. Instructions are pretty good about power lock wiring. This is *not* for the faint of heart though, you've been warned :-)
customer_reviews.author: Robert-S
